The long fore wing vein r, smooth metasomal terga 3-7 and the weak or absent transverse grooves on metasomal terga 2 and 3 are distinctive for this species.
The specific name is from the Latin longius, meaning longer, in reference to the fore wing vein r being longer than vein 3RSa.
